com.mirasense.scanditsdk
Class ScanditSDKBarcodePicker

java.lang.Object
  RelativeLayout
      com.mirasense.scanditsdk.ScanditSDKBarcodePicker
All Implemented Interfaces:
ScanditSDK
public class ScanditSDKBarcodePicker
extends RelativeLayout
implements ScanditSDK

Controls the scanning process, shows the camera in portrait mode, and informs the scan view UI about the barcode recognition state each time a new video frame has been analyzed. This class starts and stops the barcode scanning and controls which barcode symbologies are decoded. This is the current version of the scanner that uses Android API methods introduced in Android 2.2. The LegacyPortraitScanditSDKBarcodePicker is available for devices that run an older version or that have camera drivers that stop more current API methods from being used. Developers can call canRunPortraitPicker() to determine whether the particular Android device supports this picker or only the legacy version. The app implementing this SDK should either use the com.mirasense.scanditsdk.ScanditSDKAutoAdjustingBarcodePicker and show the scanner on the full screen in a new Activity or distinguish whether to use this picker or LegacyPortraitScanditSDKBarcodePicker by calling canRunPortraitPicker(). Copyright 2010 Mirasense. All rights reserved.

Constructor Detail

ScanditSDKBarcodePicker

public ScanditSDKBarcodePicker(Context context,
                               java.lang.String appKey)
Initiates the barcode picker. To enable the analytics and location capabilities of the Scandit SDK, set the parameters accordingly. The app key is mandatory and is available via the Scandit SDK website.

Parameters:
context - A context.
guiView - Scan GUI to use.
appKey - The Scandit SDK app key.

ScanditSDKBarcodePicker

public ScanditSDKBarcodePicker(Context context,
                               java.lang.Class<?> rawClass,
                               java.lang.String appKey)
Initiates the barcode picker. To enable the analytics and location capabilities of the Scandit SDK, set the parameters accordingly. The app key is mandatory and is available via the Scandit SDK website.

Parameters:
context - A context.
guiView - Scan GUI to use.
rawClass - R.raw needs to be passed to the ScanDKBarcodePicker to load resources for the ScanDKBarcodePicker.
appKey - The Scandit SDK app key.

ScanditSDKBarcodePicker

public ScanditSDKBarcodePicker(Context context,
                               java.lang.Class<?> rawClass,
                               java.lang.String appKey,
                               int cameraFacingPreference)
Initiates the barcode picker. To enable the analytics and location capabilities of the Scandit SDK, set the parameters accordingly. The app key is mandatory and is available via the Scandit SDK website.

Parameters:
context - A context.
guiView - Scan GUI to use.
rawClass - R.raw needs to be passed to the ScanDKBarcodePicker to load resources for the ScanDKBarcodePicker.
appKey - The Scandit SDK app key.
cameraFacingPreference - Which camera should be used assuming there is more than one available. Either CAMERA_FACING_BACK or CAMERA_FACING_FRONT

Method Detail

canRunPortraitPicker

public static boolean canRunPortraitPicker()
Returns true if the ScanditSDKBarcodePicker can be used in portrait scanning mode. If the method returns false (on all Android 2.1 devices and a few, selected Android 2.2 devices), use the ScanditSDKBarcodePicker in landscape mode or alternatively the LegacyPortraitScanditSDKBarcodePicker.

reset in interface ScanditSDK

getCameraPreviewImageOfFirstBarcodeRecognition

public byte[] getCameraPreviewImageOfFirstBarcodeRecognition()
Description copied from interface: ScanditSDK
Returns the image data as obtained by the Camera Preview Callback method "onPreviewFrame" of the image, in which the bar code has been recognized for the first time. (The image will be "landscape" oriented. It's dimensions can be accessed using the getCameraPreviewImageWidth() and getCameraPreviewImageHeight() methods.)

Specified by:
getCameraPreviewImageOfFirstBarcodeRecognition in interface ScanditSDK
Returns:
Byte array containing the image information in the NV21 format (YCrCb format, which uses the NV21 encoding format), or null, in case no barcode has been recognized since the recognition start or the last call of reset().

getMostRecentCameraPreviewImage

public byte[] getMostRecentCameraPreviewImage()
Description copied from interface: ScanditSDK
Returns the last image returned by the Camera. (The image will be "landscape" oriented. It's dimensions can be accessed using ScanditSDK.getCameraPreviewImageWidth() and ScanditSDK.getCameraPreviewImageHeight().)

Specified by:
getMostRecentCameraPreviewImage in interface ScanditSDK
Returns:
Byte array containing the image information in the NV21 format (YCrCb format, which uses the NV21 encoding format) or null, in case no preview image has been obtained so far

setScanningHotSpot


public void setScanningHotSpot(float relX,
                               float relY)




Description copied from interface: ScanditSDK


Changes the location of the spot where the recognition actively scans 
 for barcodes. X and Y can  be between 0 and 1, where 0/0 corresponds to 
 the top left corner and 1/1 to the bottom right corner.





Specified by:
setScanningHotSpot in interface ScanditSDK






Parameters:
relX - X position of recognition hot spot. Default is 0.5.
relY - Y position of recognition hot spot. Default is 0.5.










setScanningHotSpotHeight


public void setScanningHotSpotHeight(float height)




Description copied from interface: ScanditSDK


Changes the height of the spot where the recognition actively scans for
 barcodes. The height of the hot spot is given relative to the height of
 the screen and has to be between 0.0 and 0.5.
 Be aware that if the hot spot height is very large, the engine is forced
 to decrease the quality of the recognition to keep the speed at an 
 acceptable level.





Specified by:
setScanningHotSpotHeight in interface ScanditSDK






Parameters:
height - Relative height of the hot spot. Default is 0.25.










ignorePreviewAspectRatio


public void ignorePreviewAspectRatio()




Description copied from interface: ScanditSDK


Normally the picker adjusts to the aspect ratio of the preview image. If
 this is called, it will no longer do this.
 Warning: If the aspect ratio is not kept, the camera feed may be
 stretched and no longer be a proper representation of what is recorded.





Specified by:
ignorePreviewAspectRatio in interface ScanditSDK

set1DScanningEnabled in interface ScanditSDK

 not supported by all Scandit SDK versions)

setInverseRecognitionEnabled


public void setInverseRecognitionEnabled(boolean enabled)




Description copied from interface: ScanditSDK


Enables the detection of white on black codes. This option currently
 only works on Data Matrix codes.





Specified by:
setInverseRecognitionEnabled in interface ScanditSDK






Parameters:
enabled - Whether it should be enabled. Default is false.










setMicroDataMatrixEnabled


public void setMicroDataMatrixEnabled(boolean enabled)




Description copied from interface: ScanditSDK


Enables special settings to allow the recognition of very small Data
 Matrix codes. If this is not specifically needed, do not enable it as it
 uses considerable processing power. This setting automatically forces
 2d recognition on every frame. This option only works on devices with
 Android 2.2 or higher, it does not cause issues with lower versions but
 simply doesn't work.





Specified by:
setMicroDataMatrixEnabled in interface ScanditSDK






Parameters:
enabled - Whether it should be enabled. Default is false.










force2dRecognition


public void force2dRecognition(boolean force)




Description copied from interface: ScanditSDK


Forces the engine to always run a 2d recognition, ignoring whether a 2d
 code was detected in the current frame.





Specified by:
force2dRecognition in interface ScanditSDK






Parameters:
force - Whether it should be forced. Default is false.










switchTorchOn


public void switchTorchOn(boolean on)




Description copied from interface: ScanditSDK


Switches the torch on or off. If the torch button is enabled on the
 overlay, users can change this by clicking it.





Specified by:
switchTorchOn in interface ScanditSDK






Parameters:
on - Whether the torch should be on. Default is false.

Description copied from interface: ScanditSDK


Sets a property. This function is for internal use only and any 
 functionality that can be accessed through it can and will vanish without 
 public notice from one version to the next. Do not call this function 
 unless you specifically have to.

hasTorch


public boolean hasTorch()




Checks whether the camera has a LED that is capable of going into torch
 mode. As the camera is not instantly available, we return false until
 we can access the camera's parameters for the first time.












Returns:
True if the Camera has a torch flash mode.










isTorchBeingSet


public boolean isTorchBeingSet()




Checks whether the torch state is being changed.












Returns:
True if the Torch state is being changed.










setTorch


Enables or disables the the LED in torch mode.











Parameters:
enabled - True if the LED torch should be enabled.









onPreviewFrame


Calls the bar code recognition on the image frame and ensures the 
 recognition GUI is redrawn.











See Also:
PreviewCallback#onPreviewFrame(byte[], Camera)
